intro: Erucastrum abyssinicum, commonly known as Abyssinian cress, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Erucastrum abyssinicum is also valued for its edible leaves, which are used in local cuisine.
